prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. For part 1, there are no euler angles, and the translation vector is [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. Next, create the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. This sketch contains a single face with 4 lines. Loop_1 consists of: 1. Line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] 2. Line_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.25] 3. Line_3: [0.75, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.25] 4. Line_4: [0.0, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. Extrude the 3D sketch with extrusion depth_towards_normal 0.0, extrusion depth_opposite_normal 0.125, and a sketch_scale of 0.75. This will create a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners. Create a new coordinate system with the same euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and translation vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0]. Create the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. This sketch also contains a single face with 4 lines. Loop_1 consists of: 1. Line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.125, 0.0] 2. Line_2: [0.125, 0.0] to [0.125, 0.25] 3. Line_3: [0.125, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.25] 4. Line_4: [0.0, 0.25] to [0.0, 0.0] Now, scale the 2D sketch by 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch with extrusion depth_towards_normal as 0.25, depth_opposite_normal as 0.0, sketch_scale as 0.25, and perform a join operation with the previous part to produce a rectangular prism with rounded corners. Part 3: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. Create a new coordinate system with similar euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0], and a new translation vector: [0.125, 0.25, 0.0]. Create the 2D sketch on face_1 of the coordinate system. This sketch contains a single face with 4 lines. Loop_1 consists of: 1. Line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.0] 2. Line_2: [0.25, 0.0] to [0.25, 0.125] 3. Line_3: [0.25, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.125] 4. Line_4: [0.0, 0.125] to [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector of the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch with extrusion depth_towards_normal as 0.125, depth_opposite_normal as 0.0, sketch_scale as 0.25, and perform a join operation with the previous part to create a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional, Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat base and a flat top, and the cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of approximately 1 unit. 2D Sketch for Part 1 Begin by creating a new coordinate system for `part_1`. Create three faces `face_1`, `face_2`, `face_3` on the `X-Y` plane on the new coordinate system for `part_1`. Face 1 For `face_1`, create `loop_1` and `loop_2` as follows: 1. `loop_1` contains one circle (`circle_1`) centered at (0.375, 0.375) with a radius of 0.375 units. 2. `loop_2` contains another circle (`circle_1`) with the same center at (0.375, 0.375) and a radius of 0.2679 units. Face 2 For `face_2`, create `loop_1` consisting of: 1. one line (`line_1`) from point (0.0, 0.0104) to point (0.3644, 0.0001), 2. an arc (`arc_1`) from point (0.3644, 0.0001) to point (0.0, 0.375), 3. and one more line (`line_2`) from point (0.0, 0.375) to point (0.0, 0.0104). Face 3 For `face_3`, create `loop_1` consisting of: 1. an arc (`arc_1`) from point (0.0, 0.375) to point (0.375, 0.75), 2. one line (`line_1`) from point (0.375, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.75), 3. and another line (`line_2`) from (0.0, 0.75) to (0.0, 0.375). Scaling, Transformation, and Extrusion Scale the complete 2D sketch for `part_1` by 0.75 units using the `sketch_scale` parameter. The scaled 2D sketch is then transformed into a 3D sketch using the given Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). Extrude the 3D sketch by 0.2755 units towards the normal direction and 0 units in the opposite direction according to the `extrude_depth_towards_normal` and `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` parameters respectively. The final shape of the extruded 3D model is the desired three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
